wikipedia_page.main: Walter Robert Jack (17 November 1874 – May 1936) was a Scottish footballer who played as a centre-forward.

link_mentions.page: List of West Bromwich Albion F.C. seasons

response: The team achieved its highest league placing in the top division, which was third-place, in three separate seasons and under three different managers; Walter Jack in 1908–09 (three points behind champions Celtic), Alex Maley in 1911–12 (nine points behind champions Rangers), and Davie White in 1966–67 (twelve points behind champions Celtc).

| Walter Jack was possibly the club's first managerial appointment.The club were elected for promotion from Scottish Division Two as runners-up along with Hamilon Academical (fourth place) in 1905–06.
